body_html:
Well it's not quite that simple unfortunately. I fixed the first issue (see the branch), but the next issue is down to all of the other environment variables that are expected to exist, such as TF_CUDA_VERSION and CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH.

All fixable, but really it looks like either I'm missing something or the assumptions being made in configure regarding these environment variables aren't reasonable (namely, that bazel never dies). I haven't tried yet but the same issues possibly exist with other variables like HOST_CXX_COMPILER, TF_NEED_SYCL, etc. based on a brief look at how they are being used.

body:
Well it's not quite that simple unfortunately. I fixed the first issue (see the [branch](https://github.com/darrengarvey/tensorflow/tree/fix-cuda-failure-when-bazel-dies)), but the next issue is down to all of the other environment variables that are expected to exist, such as `TF_CUDA_VERSION` and `CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH`.

All fixable, but really it looks like either I'm missing something or the assumptions being made in `configure` regarding these environment variables aren't reasonable (namely, that bazel never dies). I haven't tried yet but the same issues possibly exist with other variables like `HOST_CXX_COMPILER`, `TF_NEED_SYCL`, etc. based on a brief look at how they are being used.
